intro: Macarthuria neocambrica, commonly known as the New Cambria macarthuria, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
